mechanics.condition: Target area is a solid surface within range
mechanics.outcome: Create a wall lasting for the duration. Choose one: a) up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, 5 feet thick OR b) a circle 20 feet diameter, up to 20 feet high, 5 feet thick.

mechanics.condition: Line of sight passes through the wall
Creature is within the wall's area
mechanics.outcome: Creature makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, creature takes 7d8 piercing damage. On a successful save, creature takes half as much piercing damage.

mechanics.condition: Creature moves 1 foot through the wall
mechanics.outcome: 1 foot of movement costs 4 feet of movement

mechanics.trigger: Creature enters the wall for the first time on a turn OR ends its turn there
mechanics.outcome: Creature makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, creature takes 7d8 slashing damage. On a successful save, creature takes half as much slashing damage.

description_text: You create a wall of tough, pliable, tangled brush bristling with needle-sharp thorns. The wall appears within range on a solid surface and lasts for the duration. You choose to make the wall up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick or a circle that has a 20-foot diameter and is up to 20 feet high and 5 feet thick. The wall blocks line of sight. When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 7d8 piercing damage, or half as much damage on a successful save. A creature can move through the wall, albeit slowly and painfully. For every 1 foot a creature moves through the wall, it must spend 4 feet of movement. Furthermore, the first time a creature enters the wall on a turn or ends its turn there, the creature must make a dexterity saving throw. It takes 7d8 slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
